summary: This document is an email chain between an Assistant United States Attorney and a judge's chambers regarding the submission of an application for a search warrant. The attorney corrects an error in the original submission (naming the wrong judge) and provides flattened PDFs for review.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Mentioned as the judge whose name was incorrectly included in the initial version of the search warrant application submitted to Judge Wang.

persons.name: Judge Wang
persons.context: The judge to whom the corrected application for a search warrant is being submitted for consideration.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The author of the email submitting the corrected search warrant application and exhibits to Judge Wang's chambers.

connections.description: The prosecutor is submitting a legal application (search warrant) for the judge's review and approval.

events.title: Submission of Search Warrant Application
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney submits a corrected application for a search warrant, along with four exhibits and a proposed warrant, to Judge Wang for consideration.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A search warrant application related to the Epstein case was submitted to Judge Wang on October 27, 2020.
The initial submission contained an error, incorrectly naming Judge Nathan instead of Judge Wang.
The application included four exhibits and a proposed search warrant.
The prosecutor noted an agent was available to swear out the warrant that afternoon or the following morning.
